cisc187.dna

Class BaseSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • cisc187.dna.BaseSequence

  • public class BaseSequence
extends Object
    Value class to store a BaseSequence.

    A BaseSequence is a sequence of letters representing the 4 amino acids found in DNA and RNA. The class also stores the sequence type. Two sequence types exist because the valid letters that can be stored in a sequence of a particular type are not the same. 

        A DNA sequence can only hold the letters: ACGT
    An RNA sequence can only hold the letters: ACGU
    It is valid for a BaseSequence to have no characters, in which case the SequenceType is EMPTY.
    Author:
    Dave Parillo

      • transcribe

        public void transcribe()
        Transcribe a DNA sequence into an RNA sequence. If this sequence is a DNA sequence, convert its type and characters into RNA. Transcription converts a DNA sequence to a sequence of RNA.

        To transcribe a DNA sequence to RNA

        • Change its type field to RNA,
        • Convert any occurrences of T to U,
        • Complement all the letters in the sequence using the table below, and
        • Reverse the sequence. 
             DNA to RNA Complements
     DNA | RNA
     =========
      A  |  U
      C  |  G
      G  |  C
      T  |  A
        If this sequence is an RNA sequence, then do nothing.

      • clip

        public BaseSequence clip(int start,
                         int end)
        Replace the sequence with a clipped version of the sequence. The clipped version is that part of the sequence beginning at character position start and ending with character position end.

        It is an error if start has a value less than zero, or if start or end are beyond the end of the sequence. A clip command with such an error makes no alteration to the sequence.

        If the value for end is less than the value for start then the result is a sequence containing no characters.

        Parameters:
        start - the start location within the sequence to be clipped
        end - the final location within the sequence to be clipped
        Returns:
        the tail of the sequence that was clipped, or an empty BaseSequence, if start orend are invalid.
